channel.title: Comments on: #DatPostmil? #2: A Present Evil Age!

item.title: By: Eleanor Bertin
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Bertin
item.description: Thank you so much for this explanation! That point about this age being, and always being evil is what has bothered me about postmillennialism. So many questions arise for me as I consider postmill thought. In postmill, wouldn't many people simply become Christians nominally because that would be the norm? If human hearts are still bound in sin, this inevitably happens as history and culture prove. You have answered these biblically

item.title: By: Clyde Pilgrim
item.dc:creator: Clyde Pilgrim
item.description: I agree with the biblical amillenialism which I think should be labelled in-millenialism or inaugurated millenialism. Thanks Pr. Dr. Sam Waldron for your irrefutable arguments for in-millenialism. Postmillenialism tends to degenerate into theonomic reconstructionism or false ecumenism based on syncretistic accomodation with papal Rome and its Babylonian daughters. This has been the historical tendency of the Godly seed of Noah and OT Israel.
